intro: Diplotaxis harra var. fontanesii, commonly known as the Sudanese wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant has small, lobed leaves and produces numerous seed pods that contain tiny, elongated seeds. It is adapted to dry conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
